result.execSummary:
The defendant Wayne D Thiele was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Interfere w/ Fire Fighting-Equipment, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.12(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: to any other sentence.  Huber release privileges for work and treatment.
Court allows sentence to be served in Dane County.

miscConds.notes: AS TO EACH COUNT:  Court waives nonmandatory costs, surcharges and assessmetns due to the large amount of restitution defendant has paid.  Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
Maintain employment unless in school.  If in school full time, defendant to have a part time job.
Mental health assessments. Cooperate with any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications but only in dosages prescribed by a physician.

No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No contact with Marcus Corporation and the downtown Hilton Hotel.

Cooperate with agent.
Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program.
AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: Same conditions as in count one.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Wayne D Thiele in court with attorney Brian C. Hough.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by State, Defense and Defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced defendant to serve 135 DAYS in the House of Corrections, consecutive to any other sentence, with Huber release privileges for work and treatment, with credit for 3 days time served.  Court STAYED sentence and placed the defendant on PROBATION for a period of  15 MONTHS with the following conditions:
-Court WAIVES non-mandatory costs, surcharges and assessments due to the large amount of restitution defendant has paid;  nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-Cooperate with agent
-Maintain employment unless in school.  If in school full-time, defendant to have a part-time job 
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program
-Mental health assessment and  cooperate with any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications but only in dosages prescribed by a physician
-No contact with Marcus Corporation and the downtown Hilton Hotel
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Court allows sentence to be served in Dane County

AS TO COUNT 2:
The Court sentenced defendant to serve 135 DAYS in the House of Corrections, consecutive to any other sentence, with Huber release privileges for work and treatment.  Court STAYED sentence and placed the defendant on PROBATION for a period of  15 MONTHS with the following conditions:
-Court WAIVES non-mandatory costs, surcharges and assessments due to the large amount of restitution defendant has paid;  nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-Cooperate with agent
-Maintain employment unless in school.  If in school full-time, defendant to have a part-time job 
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program
-Mental health assessment and  cooperate with any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications but only in dosages prescribed by a physician
-No contact with Marcus Corporation and the downtown Hilton Hotel
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Court allows sentence to be served in Dane County

Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Pretrial Credit sheet

Defendant Wayne D Thiele in court with attorney Brian C. Hough.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Original Amended Information received and filed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of the Amended Information, waives reading and enters a plea of not guilty on his clients behalf.

Defendant Wayne D Thiele in court with attorney Brian C. Hough.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court involved in a jury trial.  Matter adjourned for plea/sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Character reference letters for sentencing received and filed.

Defendant Wayne D Thiele in court with attorney Brian C. Hough.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties request an adjournment of the plea/sentencing hearing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Wayne D Thiele in court with attorney Brian C. Hough.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests plea and sentencing date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 21.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 29, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Wayne D Thiele and attorney Brian C. Hough via telephone conference.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties telephoned the Court on 6/4/15 stating that the State does not have restitution figures.  Defendant/Defense traveling from Madison.  Request made by Defense to conduct adjournment request via telephone.  
On this date, parties appeared via telephone to request an adjournment.   Court continues to retain jurisdiction.  Status conference scheduled for June 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
Letter from Attorney Brian C. Hough filing Denfendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

Defendant Wayne D Thiele in court with attorney Brian C. Hough.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Scheduling conference held between counsel. 
Defense awaiting discovery materials; request for status date granted.  Status conference scheduled for June 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Wayne D Thiele in court with attorney Brian C. Hough.  Ronald Dague for  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Zachary Johnson-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 21.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with HILTON HOTEL, 509 W WISCONSIN AVE.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Wayne D Thiele in court with attorney Alexis B Stewart.  Defendant Wayne D Thiele in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.    Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge BRASH, Branch 21.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.   Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
